title: How long would the human race last against an invading alien species? - Quora

response.answer_text: If aliens managed to cross interstellar space, and they wanted our planet, there would be nothing that we could do to stop them. Fictional aliens come to Earth and seemingly refight the Second World War because that scenario sells books and movie tickets. Here are some nightmare scenarios that don't involve jets dogfighting with flying saucers: They park in the asteroid belt, affix engines and guidance systems to huge chunks of rock, then safely bombard us from where we can't strike back.They engineer a virus that is 100% contagious and 100% deadly to humans, then release it in our atmosphere. For bonus points, it vitrifies us so that they won't have to clean up 7.6 billion rotting corpses.They engineer a drug that is 100% addictive that also has extremely unpleasant withdrawal symptoms. Again, they release it in our atmosphere. They're perfectly willing to share it with us, if we'd just give them whatever they want. Did I say that there's no antidote? Because there's no antidote.They introduce us to a concept that causes humans to have severe psychological breakdowns, then they sit back and watch the mass suicides and murders.They give advanced technology, weapons, and defenses to ONE human faction that is particularly aggressively expansive, then stand back. Of course these “gifts" aren't advanced enough to pose a threat to the aliens.They release a biological or chemical weapon into the atmosphere that causes human sterility. They crossed interstellar space, surely they have the patience to wait the eighty so years that it would take humanity to go extinct.They show up with a fleet of ships that's impressive both in number, as well as in firepower. Then they tell us that they're here to protect us from the “bad" aliens. Now that we're “friends”, they just need us to do a few favors, and give them a few gifts.They seed the planet with trillions of spores of their planet's version of kudzu or cane toads. Surprise! They're not simply plants or animals. Each organism is a component of a terraforming system. The goal is to make the planet inhospitable to us and cozy as an old quilt for them.
